definition: willing to face danger, an amusement or pastime, place a bet on
details:
adjective
- willing to face danger
= synonyms: spirited
- disabled in the feet or legs
= synonyms: halting, crippled, halt, lame, gimpy
noun
- an amusement or pastime
= example: an amusement or pastime
- a contest with rules to determine a winner
= example: a contest with rules to determine a winner
- a single play of a sport or other contest
= example: a single play of a sport or other contest
- frivolous or trifling behavior
= example: frivolous or trifling behavior
- your occupation or line of work
= example: your occupation or line of work
= synonyms: biz
- animal hunted for food or sport
- the game equipment needed in order to play a particular game
= example: the game equipment needed in order to play a particular game
- a secret scheme to do something (especially something underhand or illegal)
= synonyms: plot, secret plan
- the flesh of wild animals that is used for food
- (games) the score at a particular point or the score needed to win
= example: (games) the score at a particular point or the score needed to win
- (tennis) a division of play during which one player serves
verb
- place a bet on
= synonyms: punt
